S.FORM: pt’aring sami miru la, myup pkba’an myan psba biru, kmayan pgleng myan maha “tuli! tubun tunux!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: hmnyang sami maha “lokah su pcba biru.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: mkbaga sami ga, cba’an sami ni pcba biru sa lmpu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

S.FORM: kbalung sami pcba biru lmpu, m’uwas sami uwas na lmpu.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: pyux kay na S’uli Tayan ba’un mu la.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Tayal languages.

S.FORM: musa kung miru krryax, kbaga kung kay na S’uli Tayan krryax skayan mu ki yaya mu mung.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: lalu mu ga Amuy Pihaw.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Amuy Pihaw。
My name is Amuy Pihaw.

S.FORM: lalu ni yaba mu ga Pihaw Bawxin.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Pihaw Bawxin。
My dad’s name is Pihaw Bawxin.

S.FORM: lalu ni yaya mu ga Pitay Tuyaw.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Pitay Tuyaw。
My mother’s name is Pitay Tuyaw.

S.FORM: mpuw kayan mu misu la.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: kyan utux bsuyan mu tmalung, lalu nya ga Tahus Pihaw, mpuw utux kayan nya la.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Tahus Pihaw，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: niya sami mgluw miru sku utux pkba’an biru.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: kuzing ru bsuyan mu tmalung Tahus ga sgalan myan m’uwas.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: smogan kung mlngya, ryax hngi’an mutu sami mgluw musa mlngya utux sali.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: smogan kung mkbba sa g’anus rawin ba sami mgluw m’uwas ru mlngya.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: kuzing ga la’i na Atayan.
S.TRANSL: 我是泰雅族的小孩。
I am an Atayal child.

S.FORM: niya mki syaw Lyung Penux sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在大安溪旁。
Our family lives by the Da’an River.

S.FORM: magan hi kwara sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tugan hi ku mntsway myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: mgluw sami myanux ki yaba yaya bsuyan tmalung ru bsuyan knerin.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: bawi balay yaba mu yaba mu ga kinsat.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mhikang balay yaya mu yaya mu ga kuysang.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: mki sali mutu sami kyalun kay tayan ni yaba.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Atayal language with us at home.

S.FORM: mhngi ’bagan ga mutu sami musa alang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: bsuyan mu tmalung ru knerin ki kuzing mgluw sami kmyap takay.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: sgalan mu balay utux sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: sami ki yaya mnwah mgnaw tanux soni.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: memaw mslingaw ku babaw kayan sku slwan, ini kskinut ru ini kkilux ku kayan, memaw blay sinbehuyan nya.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: tl’ung sami babaw be’nux k’man mani sa pang, mb’ya sku hi kinmli na witux, memaw yemli.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: babw kinryax lga mtanah ku kayan la.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: p’usan mu yaya, huwa ka mtanah kayan la.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: kmayan yaya maha kyala mmwah rhuyan la.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: gbyan lga ungat yulung mki babaw kayan mhtu ku yangah la.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: mmosa sami sali uziy la.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: mki tu’iy na ’binah sali ga, kyalun mu ku yangah.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: mwani laxiy ’wah rhuyan, smogan kung musa mgnaw tanux na.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: niya mki syaw sali myan ku pkba’an biru myan, hmakay kung musa miru krryax, hmakay uziy mwah sali.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ini krahu pkba’an biru myan, ini khbayaw mkbaga biru, mkbba sami kwara.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: kwara lla’i mutu sami mlahuy sku pgnahan, mgluw mnaw mari, mpcisan.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: mgluw sami mgnaw uziy pcba biru, wiwan utux rahu na sali ku pkba’an biru.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: siki kmagaw sami krryax, kwagan myan ru ini k’uraw ku pbrwan myan la.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: kruma ga mi’ing riwan na nyaway kruma ga kmagaw rhyan.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: mutu myan kwagan kwara ana inu ’ung na pkba’an biru, psugun myan ku yaw myan ru pkrraw sami, ini k’uraw balay krryax ku pkba’an myan biru.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: shisa mnwah kung alang mtayux yutas.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: bsya sami ini pktayux la snun mu balay hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: txan kung ni yutas lga pkni’an kung nya bahat pnuban kung nya ocya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: sbing balay bahat pinuhi ni yutas blay balay ni’un.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: sgalan mu uziy ocya ni yutas blay nubun uziy.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: ’lyan lga kuzing ki yaki mgluw phapuy kryaxun.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: pyux tnahuk ni yaki syux wilung abang ru tmang.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: babaw kinryax lga musa sami pinhyan yasay kmyut tbihi.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: mnagan pyux ngahi sehuy ru inu tayan ku yaki sbay kung nya maha aras sali.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: sgayan mu laha ru kyalun mu maha babaw ryax halan mu tayux laha.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: rasun sami ni pcba biru musa klhangan lmlalu sin’anan soni mbku sami blihun nya mbaziy kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: myup sami sahuy yengayan lmlamu sin’anan lga kmayan pcba biru maha te gleng ga kkbhni te suruw ga m’u usa tayux nanak simu.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mngungu kung m’u nanu ye’asa ini kung usa tayux m’u.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: txan mu pyux kkbhni niya plaka babaw khoni txan mu uziy puk ki m’abi bling khoni.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: kyan zo uma klit mki klhangan sin’anan ’yat mu kintxan kwara ’sinu hani txan mu soni m’as balay inlungan mu.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: pyux pinsyasing mu spkita mu yaba yaya.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: babaw nya pgluw sami ki yaba yaya muwah.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: hngi’an ryax wayan hani ga bsuyan mu knerin ru kung mnwah sami Bnka tayux mama.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台北拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taipei to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: t’aring sami Tuyuhara mluw kisya musa Bnka.
S.TRANSL: 我們從豐原搭火車去臺北。
We took the train from Fengyuan to Taipei.

S.FORM: tehuk sami Bnka lga mniray haya ru muwah n_gan kisya mlmuh sami ku mama.
S.TRANSL: 到了台北，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taipei, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ini ktwahi ku hnari n_gan kisya ru sali na mama miray haya ini kbsya tehuk la.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: llingay sali ni mama ga kyan utux rahu na kklhangan kating mit mgluw sami miray ling ling aya musa kya.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: mki sami klhangan mit kating lga rasun sami ni mama musa sma’an mit ru mluw uma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: gbyan lga mgluw sami musa heci kgabi.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: pyux haya traku mki heci nanu ye’asa ku miray sami otobay musa kya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: pshri sami lga txan ga wayan kri’un otobay la ’si sami gluw bas mshri.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: misu soni niya sami mbinah Tuyuhara ba’aw ta wayan luwan ni mama ku otobay nya la.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到豐原了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Fengyuan, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: trang la’i kung na ga mki Mekarang sali myan, miru kung lga musa sami myanux Cikuto la, ’si sami kyanux heci la.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在梅花，上學以後，就搬到了竹東，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Mekarang. After I started school, we moved to Zhudong and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: miru kung rahu bbrwan lga, minkbaga kung utux pkba’an gaga na Gyenzyumin, ba’un mu ku pyux lmlamu ru blay gaga na Gyenzyumin Zok.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: nanu ye’asa, mhngi ’ruyux ’bagan hani ga, bsuyan mu tmalung ru kuzing, mnwah sami alang ma’ut nnbkis, nki myan ba’un gaga myan nanak.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: mspat pgan kayan ku nbkis la, ana ga txan ’si ga nisan mziman kayan na.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像才剛滿五十歲的中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: p’usan mu hiya nenanu kay ba’un nya, pyang yuci ku knayan nya kay Tayan, ba uziy kmayan kay na Ngayngay ru kay Gipun.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的泰雅語說得很流利，也會說客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: p’usan mu hiya lga ba’un mu, aw ba sa mniru sku kay Gipun knerin nya, ga tayan mtyaw ga, ba’un nya hbayaw Ngayngay, nanu ye’asa ku pyux kay ba’un nya.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: trang mppa’ut ru mpcisan sami ga, pyux knayan nku nbkis, yaw ru kinba’an na ’mlyap.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ana myan ini thyaziy mung kwara, si kila, wayan myan syun sku soci, musa myan nble’un mung lozi.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: la’i kung na ga ini mu ba’iy gaga nanak, sksayux mu cikay kuzing ga Gyenzyumin.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: pyux ba’un lga, llungun mu kuzing ga Atayan, minnanak balay, kahun inlungan mu p’asun mu balay uziy la.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為賽夏族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: gbyan kisa mmwah sali ku sway tmalaung la.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: yaki ru kung musa sami bnasan yasay mbaziy wilung mnama tmahuk blay ni’un na kgbyun nku sway tmalung.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去菜攤買雞，預備給弟弟煮豐盛的晚餐。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: hminas sami sku bnasan tbihi pyux ku memaw mtasi na tbihi.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mbaziy sami sa kungsincay saku ru tanah sopu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: kmayan ku syaw ka bnasan bebuway na lawpan maha phngaran ru zimuh mu ga pyang ssbing baziy cikay.
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: minnaziy sami pngaran ru zimux.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: hminas sami bnasan hi wilung kmayan Lawpan nanu bnasun su wilung soni ga rahu ru msyam utux wilung ga cyugan kbhun.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: lokah s’yung la ma yaki p’usan nya Lawpan blay khuyun cikay.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: ana ga kmayan Lawpan rema mhnuk la ’yat thyayun khuy la.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: mki bih ku lawpan kmayan maha uwah baziy syux mu syux mu ga rahu ru mhnuk.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: te pucing mbaziy sami wilung ru syux uziy muwah sami sali tmnahuk sami utux lalan rami.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: bsya sami mnaga gbyan la.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: niyan reng_wa ni sway mu tmalung maha si tbah ini swayan mhngi ku hitay siki rayx babaw rehay thuyay muwah sali la.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: kmayan yaki pyux pinhapuy ta kayan kwara muwah mgluw mani!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: tpihun myan kwara gegluw ru rerawin muwah mlaw sa memaw blay na kgbyun.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: kyan utux rawin mu, lalu nya ga Hayang, mutu mngya maras ye’aya krryax.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Hayung，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Hayung, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: miru sami lga, mutu mkura sku mtna mkbaga biru ksyuk sa inpit, i’ing, ini ga rban.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: minxaliy, minsazing, mincyugan mutu myan ksyugan han.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ana ga kyan utux ya’ih na lhnyun nya, ksyuk ye’aya lga, ini nya psyugi may ye’aya hasa la.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: babaw nya, ini sami sogan pksyuk ye’aya ki hiya la.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: kyan utux ryax, mgluw sami kwara musa mgnaw tetanux.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: mki sami ska tu’iy, nki musa mstanux ku Hayung, ana ga yengan nya maras rban i’ing.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Hayung想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Hayung wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: nki ksyuk sku mtna mkbaga biru, ana ga syukun naha kwara maha, ini kung aras uziy.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: memaw khlan ku Hayung, ru mngilis minbci maha, huwa simu ini pksyuk kuzing rban i’ing!!
S.TRANSL: Hayung急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Hayung burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kyalun nku mtna mkbaga biru ku hiya, ye’igi, ini su aras nanak, ru pinksyuk myan isu ye’aya ga, ini su wahiy may la!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: kinsasan nya mgyebu, muwah miru ru tehuk pkba’an biru ku Hayang, wayan nya pbnahun may mtna mkbaga biru kwara ye’aya naha.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Hayang很早就到學校了，Hayang把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Hayung arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: mkura sku mgluw mkbaga biru ku Hayung, tmatuk tunux maha, babaw nya p’aras kung nanak ye’aya, mhuway simu uziy, pinksyuk ki hiya.
S.TRANSL: Hayung向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Hayung apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: mki alang myan, yaba mu ga pyang ba ’mlyap s’uli.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: la’i kung na ga, trang gbyan lga, yaba ru mama mutu maras puting ru patus musa tanux.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: sluwan lga, mutu niya maras sa ’sinu muwah sali.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: kruma ga bewak nahi, kruma ga yapit, kya ruma uziy ga la’ung.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: mutu mki sku kyupan alang ku laha, ’masu may ’sinu sku kwara utux alang.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: mutu kung mkebu yaba maha, pgluw kung isu musa ’mlyap.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba maha, rahu su lga rasaw misu mluw kung la.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: ttmalung na alang, mutu kbalay luyang tmiri ’sinu, mutu kbalay luyang ru wahiy.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: pyang ba kbalay luyang yaba mu, kmayan yaba maha, hani ga ttiri la’ung, siki nble’un ta tayux pilung na ’’sinu, wahiy ga siki syun sku tu’iy hkayan na ’’sinu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ye’igi smogan kung helaw mgluw binkis musa ’mlyap, kbaga kung posa luyang krryax, yanga balay wayan tmiru ’sinu ku luyang mu la.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: txan ni yaba lru, kyalun kung nya maha, babaw nya musa su pyang ba trgyax.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: misu soni, niya kung rahu la, spanga mu ku boli ru tlak mu, gmluw yaba musa ’mlyap.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: mbinah sami alang lga, s’asu myan ku tniri ’sinu ki kwara s’uli.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba maha, siki tmubun ta bbinkisan maha, mhuway simu may oyat, pyux tniri myan ’’sinu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: makasu’i kung tayhuk pakaba’an biru mayabu sawni la.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: musa kung i pakaba’an biru ga, yamngiya kung maras su kabang mu la.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ini kung aras ninanu na yayuwaw.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: miru sami ga, gamalu kung matayux biru ki bays mu miru.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: pasapung ga, kasiyukan kung nya inpit ru i’ing ku galuw mu miru.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kyalun kung ni pasaba biru maha, “sa’utux la ga kayabu hazi matuli, laxiy i kasu’i la ki!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: rawin mu ga Kusaw hiya ga la’i na Tayan uziy.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Kusaw，他也是泰雅族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Kusaw, and he is also an Tayal child.

S.FORM: magalu sami miru i alang Maypuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在象鼻部落讀書。
We study together in the Maypuwan tribe.

S.FORM: mutu sami magaluw karariyax mung su yayuwaw sarari na yutas, ba sami kwara kamayan kayi na Tayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

S.FORM: babawi ru katahuy kung, Kusaw ga kahi ru rarawu uziy.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Kusaw很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Kusaw is short and thin.

S.FORM: haylaw ku Kusaw, balay naha kwara hiya.
S.TRANSL: Kusaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Kusaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: pagazinah ku pakaba’an biru sawni, payaux ku panawsa pakaba’an biru su pasapangan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: kiyan hamuluy saniyuw, papay’un mariy, mazinzh ru pasapung bahawni.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: psapung su mazinah kung hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: mazinah kung ga, matakuy kung la, payux ramuyux ku tari mu.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: sikila ga matuli kung, musa kung tagalayng mazinah lawziy.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: tayhuk kung i mumu’ tahakan ga pa’asun kwara na tayan.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ana kung ini agan su icibang ga, sikila ga payang kung ma’as, ya’igi waya mu masu’un anuwah pasapung kani.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: kuzing ki yaba mu musa matisan ki mama mu su sahaysa.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: mapakngih kuzih ni mama la.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kyalun sami niya， magali mabaka’ utux takayu ku ramu’iy sali.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: tamapang saku ramu’iy sali kiya ga, kahun saku ramu’iy masahutaw ti hugan la.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: maras su hi kating ru pinnang ku yaba bay niya mama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: matisan sami ti abiyan ki mama mu, payux pinyuwan niya su yayuwaw sarali.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: minhari su a’awsa mu ga, sapa’as kung ni mama mu maha babawi su la, ru waya hayuti ku inrakyasan su uziy la.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: maha kung, “naw mu su balay kuzih mama la ga, uwah matisan sali mu su sa’utux.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: maki su kayan ti 2022 (sazing siyan mapusan sazing kayan), kiya nakaygi Sefu ka minbunsyu Yencumin balay siyun baniru su lalu na Tayan la.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: pinusan mu ku basiya masina ki Sefu sasiyan lalu Tayan ku minbunsyu ka sining alang Noami Kulas.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Noami Kulas。
I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: minkayan kung ki hiya masatana’a ta ti pahangi’an hani ga musa kung ma’ut ti sali niya.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: maki sa ma’ut hani ga, galuwnan kung niya pinayu’ ku inkahulan lalu niya, ru pasaba niya uziy ku mayanux si sali ki alang niya.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: pa’usan mu hiya maha huwa su sapawzit sa’ayung ku a’iyu lalu hani, baniru su sarali ga ya’ih pi?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: sawun kung niya maha, ya’igi sakahun su lalu cyukuk ga ini niya patahakiy sa’ayung kakusa na lalu niya, mutu naha sawun maha 「那先生」, misa su mutu ya’ani ku sapasiya naha uziy ma.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Na Xian Sheng

S.FORM: maha Noami Kulas, “baniru lalu su kayi na Yencumin hani ku payang ta lalu balay, niwan na inkahulan nakisan Atayan, ru utux sali nabakis, lalu nanak saxa’ mayanux hani ga, muwa na saluwan hmkani sabanahan nanak kwara lalu naha ki.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Noami Kulas said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: gamalu kung ki yaki mu musa i pabakagan tabaziy su sahaysa, maras su pinnuhiy niya nanak na tabihiy ru sakalay niya su satalam nani’un kwara na Yencumin.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: sabalay’an naha kwara ku tabanasan ni yaki, tiku tamayluh ru raki tumun payux tayan bamaziy ki, payux uziy ku muwah tamalam su tanahuk niya rami.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: tiku tanahuk niya ka mala’ ru myux rahakay payang i balay ni’un, kiya utux ka anising niya su ma’aw ka hi na baywak nahiy, mimaw hamuluy su habayaw okyak ku sanawkang niya ma.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: tamahuk rami ku yaki mu ga, mutu kung i tamapih su okyak, maki kung sasiyaw hamuwaw kung maha, “tabihiy ga nuhiy miyan nanak ki, kiyan na azi naya su hinbaka’an niya nanak, ihihazi uwah mabaziy yu!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: ini kyanga masu’un tabaziy ku tabihiy miyan la, kamayan yaki maha, “ya’igi kiyan isu ramaw kwara ma.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: tiku pintayuwaw hani ga, niya mu sakaba’an ku sawun sasiyup ka’amam na Yencumin ru ninanu kwara nani’un ka kinba naha, ru tinlaman mu la ku na’abuk tabanasan haniy.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: taxan mu ku anihun sanawgan su nani’un kwara rarami Tayan sarali ka lungan yaki mu ga, payang mu sapawsa su satarahu’ ru sapa’as lungan balay la.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
